meanings.definition: A type of soil characterized by a bleached, acidic, sandy surface layer and a dark, organic-rich subsoil.
meanings.sent1: The podsols in the forest have a pale top layer and a dark lower layer.
meanings.sent2: Farmers avoid planting crops in podsols due to their poor fertility.
meanings.sent3: The podsols whispered secrets to the curious earthworms below.
meanings.sent4: The podsols were like a two-tone painting, with their contrasting layers.
meanings.sent5: Walking on podsols felt like stepping on a sandy sponge.

meanings.definition: Plural form of podsol, referring to multiple instances of the soil type.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study podsols to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent2: Hikers marveled at the beauty of the podsols spread across the valley.
meanings.sent3: The podsols gathered for a soil convention to discuss their experiences.
meanings.sent4: The podsols stood together like an army of earthy soldiers.
meanings.sent5: Birds perched on the podsols, enjoying the view from above.
